data.title: Attacks in France Point to a Threat Beyond Extremist Networks
data.description: The most recent attackers were isolated, self-radicalized individuals. That has raised questions about the government’s response.
data.author: By Norimitsu Onishi, Constant Méheut and Layli Foroudi

data.title: Lous and the Yakuza Makes Music From Her Life’s Darkness
data.description: At 24, the songwriter, singer and rapper has fled one war and lived through the aftermath of another. Now, bridging continents, she tells an autobiographical story with her debut album.
data.author: By Geneva Abdul

data.title: An Afghan Mayor Expected to Die. Instead, She Lost Her Father.
data.description: Zarifa Ghafari, one of the few female mayors in Afghanistan, has been subjected to death threats and assassination attempts, and believes her father was gunned down because of her.
data.author: By Fatima Faizi and Thomas Gibbons-Neff

data.title: ‘This Is Not Democracy’: Myanmar Prepares for a Troubled Election
data.description: The vote on Sunday will render a verdict not only on the country’s fragile constitutional settlement but also on its civilian leader, the Nobel Peace Prize laureate Daw Aung San Suu Kyi.
data.author: By Hannah Beech and Saw Nang

data.title: A Good Night for Biden
data.description: And what else you need to know today.
data.author: By David Leonhardt

data.title: News Quiz: U.S. Election, Sean Connery, International Space Station
data.description: Did you follow the headlines this week?
data.author: Compiled by Will Dudding, Anna Schaverien and Jessica Anderson

data.title: Your Friday Briefing
data.description: Counting continues in the U.S. election.
data.author: By Natasha Frost

data.title: American Tribalism, Australian Reflections
data.description: Watching the United States choose a president from Sydney, our correspondent wonders: When will all the division end?
data.author: By Damien Cave

data.title: Guatemala Mudslides Kill More Than 50
data.description: Another 23 people across Central America have died or are missing as a result of a vast storm system dumping heavy rainfall across the region.
data.author: By Kirk Semple and Oscar Lopez

data.title: E.S. Reddy, Who Led U.N.’s Efforts Against Apartheid, Dies at 96
data.description: An Indian-born acolyte of Gandhi, he campaigned for boycotts, divestments and other protests against the South African government.
data.author: By Sam Roberts
